**LIBRARIES**
```{r,eval=FALSE}
rm(list=ls())
.packages = c("flexdashboard")
.inst <- .packages %in% installed.packages()
if(length(.packages[!.inst]) > 0) install.packages(.packages[!.inst])
lapply(.packages, require, character.only=TRUE)
```

# Create Dashboard
File -> New File -> R Markdown -> From Template -> Flex Dashboard

metadata:
```{r, eval=FALSE}

--
title: "Deneme"
output: flexdashboard::flex_dashboard
        orientation: column # default or rows
       # vertical_layout: scroll
--
```

# Create Column
```{r, eval=FALSE}

Column {data-width=650}
-----------------------------------

  
  
Column {data-width=650}
-----------------------------------

```

You can give names to columns to be practical. Column names will not appear in dashboard. 

Use 14 or more '-'

Every chart is placed in one column. One column can include multiple charts. Dashboard width = 1000

```


# Dashboard Layout

Dashboard width = 1000. Arrange column widths 'Column {data-width=650}'

For arranging row-wise:
```{r, eval=FALSE}

--
title: "Deneme"
output: flexdashboard::flex_dashboard
        orientation:rows 
--
```

'Column{data-height=650}'

fore more:
https://rmarkdown.rstudio.com/flexdashboard/layouts.html
